description.narrative: El Salvador - Connectivity Project: Reduce travel cost and time within the Northern Zone by designing, constructing, and rehabilitating a two-lane paved road which will serve as a national transport artery and augment El Salvador's international connectivity.

title.narrative: Measuring Results of the El Salvador Connectivity Project

condition.narrative: Additional Condition: All payments made for the Connectivity Project after September 20, 2012 must be processed using a special Payment Request Form approved by the Resident Country Director of MCC in El Salvador.

Adequate funding is programmed for the completion of all new bridge projects resulting from the feasibility study and final design of the NTH and the NCR prior to disbursement for construction or physical works in the third year of the Compact term.
FOVIAL has included in its maintenance plan and funding in calendar year 2009 and each year thereafter prior to disbursement for construction or physical works for connectivity project

Government has conducted an EIA, a feasibility study, and partial design activities, to include the development of EMPs, any required RAPs, and HIV/AIDS awareness plan prior to disbursement for construction or physical works for Connectivity Project
MOP has prepared, with the participation of FOVIAL, a detailed maintenance plan prior to disbursement for construction or physical works for connectivity project.

Prior to disbursement in calendar year 2010 for construction o physical works for Connectivity Project MOP has updated its bridge management system for the monitoring and maintenance tracking of all bridge structures included in the national road network.
Prior to disbursement in calendar year 2010 for construction o physical works for Connectivity Project, FOMILENIO has delivered to MCC MOP?s bridge replacement or rehabilitation plan.

Prior to initial disbursement in the fifth year for connectivity project Funding is programmed for completion of construction activities to replace or rehabilitate the unsafe bridges. A deferral to this CP was approved by Disbursement request response letter dated October 3, 2011, in spite of the following intermediate milestones were set due by December 2011: (i) by October 31, 2011, the Ministerio de Obras P?blicas (MOP), through FOMILENIO, shall have delivered to MCC a plan to institutionalize and update its bridge maintenance system; (ii) by December 16,2011, FOMILENIO shall have delivered to MCC evidence that the plan referred to in milestone (i) above is being implemented.(iii) by January 15,2012, FOMILENIO shall have delivered to MCC evidence of reforms implemented to improve FOVIAL's financial position (iv) by March 10, 2012, FOMILENIO shall have delivered to MCC a report describing its strategy to program funds for rehabilitation or replacement of all Northern Zone bridges flagged by the bridge maintenance system as unsafe o requiring significant maintenance, FOMILENIO shall also have delivered to MCC evidence that MOP has staffing allocations and internal procedures necessary to ensure on-going updates to the bridge maintenance system.

Prior to the initial MCC Disbursement for construction or physical works under any contract for the implementation of the connectivity project that includes roads that connect with an international border the Government has delivered an implementation plan that includes roads that connect with an international border.
Resettlement Action Plan in compliance with World Bank's Operational Policy on Involuntary Resettlement (OP 4.12)

The National Registry Center has sufficient resources to implement the first phase of the action plan for the Northern Zone prior to disbursement for construction or physical works for connectivity project
